verses.text: Then Judith fell upon \add her\add* face, and put ashes upon her head, and uncovered the sackcloth wherewith she was clothed; and about the time that the incense of that evening was offered in Jerusalem in the house of the Lord, Judith cried with a loud voice, and said,

O Lord God of my father Simeon, to whom thou gavest a sword to take vengeance of the strangers, who loosened the girdle of a maid to defile \add her\add*, and discovered the thigh to \add her\add* shame, and polluted her virginity to \add her\add* reproach; for thou saidst, It shall not be so; and \add yet\add* they did \add so:\add*
wherefore thou gavest their rulers to be slain, so that they dyed their bed in blood, being deceived, and smotest the servants with \add their\add* lords, and the lords upon their thrones;

and hast given their wives for a prey, and their daughters to be captives, and all their spoils to be divided amongst thy dear children; which were moved with thy zeal, and abhorred the pollution of their blood, and called upon thee for aid: O God, O my God, hear me also a widow.

For thou hast wrought not only those \add things\add*, but also the \add things\add* which fell out before, and which ensued after; thou hast thought upon the \add things\add* which are now, and which are to come.
Yea, what \add things\add* thou didst determine were ready at hand, and said, Lo, we are here: for all thy ways \add are\add* prepared, and thy judgments \add are\add* in \add thy\add* foreknowledge.

For behold, the Assyrians are multiplied in their power; they are exalted with horse and man; they glory in the strength of \add their\add* footmen; they trust in shield, and spear, and bow, and sling; and know not that thou art the Lord that breakest the battles: the Lord \add is\add* thy name.

Throw down their strength in thy power, and bring down their force in thy wrath: for they have purposed to defile thy sanctuary, \add and\add* to pollute the tabernacle where thy glorious name resteth, and to cast down with sword the horn of thy altar.
Behold their pride, \add and\add* send thy wrath upon their heads: give into mine hand, \add which am\add* a widow, the power that I have conceived.
Smite by the deceit of my lips the servant with the prince, and the prince with the servant: break down their stateliness by the hand of a woman.

For thy power \add standeth\add* not in multitude, nor thy might in strong \add men:\add* for thou art a God of the afflicted, a helper of the oppressed, an upholder of the weak, a protector of the forlorn, a saviour of them that are without hope.
I pray thee, I pray thee, O God of my father, and God of the inheritance of Israel, Lord of the heavens and earth, Creator of the waters, King of every creature, hear thou my prayer:

and make my speech and deceit to be their wound and stripe, who have purposed cruel \add things\add* against thy covenant, and thy hallowed house, and \add against\add* the top of Sion, and \add against\add* the house of the possession of thy children.
And make every nation and tribe to acknowledge that thou art the God of all power and might, and \add that\add* there is none other that protecteth the people of Israel but thou.
